item.title: Resident Evil 4 Fan Shows Off Ada Wong Cosplay
item.description:
Summary

  • Ada Wong's cosplay from Resident Evil 4 remake has received praise from fans for its accuracy and attention to detail.
  • Ada Wong is a popular character in the Resident Evil series, known for her mysterious nature and combat skills.
  • Despite some controversy around Ada Wong's depiction in the Resident Evil 4 remake, her overall iconic red aesthetic remains intact.

A Resident Evil 4 fan has cosplayed as Ada Wong and shared the effort with fans of the game. The cosplay has received a lot of attention and praise from players, and is just one indication of Ada Wong's star status among Resident Evil 4 characters and the cast at large.

For much of the Resident Evil series, Ada Wong has been a mysterious character that follows her own rules. Sometimes Ada can be a big help to protagonists - typically Leon S. Kennedy - but she can also trick and backstab others if it works in her favor. The femme fatale's appearance, combat prowess, and overall mystery has kept her in the minds of many Resident Evil fans, who are generally happy to see her pop up from time to time across the series' entries.

Over on Reddit, cosplayer KumaMori11 has shared a look at their cosplay of the iconic Ada Wong. The cosplay look is based off of her Resident Evil 4 remake standard appearance where she wears a long-sleeved, high-necked, red mini-dress. KumaMori11 has replicated Ada's look, with the dress, gun holsters, gloves, boots, and a pistol, for good measure. While the cosplayer's boots differ from Ada's with higher heels, platforms, and laces, overall, the entire look is very close to how Ada is depicted in-game.

Reddit Users Respond to Impressive Ada Cosplay

Numerous fans of the game have left comments for the cosplayer, with the vast majority praising the effort. One fan pointed out that the elevator the Ada cosplayer is posing in looks a lot like the laser hall in Resident Evil 4 , where Ada has to perform a series of well-timed acrobatics and grappling hook maneuvers in order to make it through the deadly lasers without getting sliced up. Another fan hoped that they would eventually see a cosplayer with Ada's iconic TMP SMG or grappling hook, to which KumaMori11 responded that maybe they would do it "sometime."

While there was some controversy surrounding the Resident Evil 4 remake's version of Ada Wong, it was primarily due to the vocal performance of the actor portraying her. Some fans were also disappointed that Ada didn't wear her iconic long red dress from the original Resident Evil 4 in the main campaign, but the alteration was made in order to make the game a little more realistic in her depiction, while still maintaining the overall trademark red aesthetic Ada has been known for since her introduction in Resident Evil 2 . While Ada's involvement in future games is unknown for now, chances are the character's appearances thus far will keep cosplayers inspired for many years to come.

item.title: Haunted Chocolatier Waiting Room Playlist
item.description:
Haunted Chocolatier is one of the most highly-anticipated games at the moment. Among the likes of unreleased heavy-hitters, like GTA 6 and The Elder Scrolls 6 , Haunted Chocolatier serves as a humble indie title that many gamers are eagerly awaiting. The idea behind Haunted Chocolatier is simple, but incredibly charming.

In Haunted Chocolatier , players will take on the role of a candy maker who also happens to live in a haunted castle. Part candy-making simulator, part exploration-based adventure, Haunted Chocolatier promises a cozy game that features some fun spooky elements. Unfortunately, according to solo developer Eric Barone, it may be a while before Haunted Chocolatier is ready. On the bright side, though, there are several titles that could be great options to pass the time before Haunted Chocolatier launches.

Games to Play While Waiting for Haunted Chocolatier

Stardew Valley

This is the obvious option to tie players over, but it's also one of the strongest choices, as it's bound to feel incredibly similar to Haunted Chocolatier . Stardew Valley was Eric Barone's first game, and the indie darling continues to be a hit. Haunted Chocolatier is bound to have some differences compared to its predecessor, but based on early footage, the aesthetic and general energy of Stardew Valley is still very much intact. Over the years, Stardew Valley has been filled with content through developer-supported updates and fan-made mods, giving players plenty of ways to keep their experience fresh. Since its launch, Stardew Valley has been one of the most influential indie games of its generation, and it set the stage for Haunted Chocolatier to become a reality.

Stardew Valley has sold over 41 million copies.

Strange Horticulture

For those who are particularly interested in Haunted Chocolatier 's blend of coziness and the paranormal, Strange Horticulture might be a great option to find that balance. In this indie title, players take on the role of the Horticulturist. As the owner of the local plant shop, interacting with a unique cast of characters teaches players about the world one lives in, as a compelling occult mystery begins to unravel throughout the story. It's a laid-back experience that could be a strong choice for those in the mood for something dark that isn't necessarily horror.

Cult of the Lamb

Cult of the Lamb may not be a life sim, but this charming roguelike leans heavily into the cuteness that Stardew Valley and Haunted Chocolatier boast. The goal of Cult of the Lamb is to build one's cult with followers in order to become the one true religion of the forest. It's a hilarious cartoonish take on dark subject matter that can scratch the spooky itch that the absence of Haunted Chocolatier leaves.

Cozy Grove

Keeping in theme with the paranormal, Cozy Grove blends a haunted forest setting with the life sim genre. As a Spirit Scout, Cozy Grove players become friends with ghosts and maintain the forest. Its gameplay loop is similar to Animal Crossing , but the unique premise behind Cozy Grove makes it an easy-going life sim that holds a deep well of charm.

Dredge

Dredge is a fishing life sim with a dark twist. Like Haunted Chocolatier , Dredge requires players to maintain their own business, except this game deals with the life of a fisherman instead of a chocolate maker. However, Dredge goes a step further and introduces an array of fascinating sea monsters that give the game a fun horror edge. Upgrading one's boat and navigating unknown waters makes Dredge a little more sweat-inducing at times, but for those who enjoy the management mechanics of Stardew Valley and love adorably dark worlds, the fishing sim could be a strong Haunted Chocolatier appetizer.

item.title: Splitgate 2 Update Roadmap Revealed
item.description:
Summary

  • A content roadmap for Splitgate 2 reveals big plans for the game in the months ahead.
  • The Splitgate 2 open beta starts May 22 with nine new maps, three new modes, and more.
  • The roadmap reveals regular updates over the summer, including a new power weapon.

Developer 1047 Games has revealed the content roadmap for Splitgate 2 , giving fans an idea of what to expect from the game. While Splitgate 2 does not fully launch until this summer, this roadmap shows what is coming at the start of the open beta and beyond.

Fortunately, fans do not have to wait long to experience the open beta, as it starts on May 22. Leading up to its release, 1047 Games has given fans multiple looks at the game, including closed playtests. While the game takes elements from the original Splitgate , such as the iconic portal mechanic, the development team looked to evolve the first-person shooter in a sequel. Among the changes, Splitgate 2 features three factions: Aeros, Meridian, and Sabrask. These factions give players different weapons and abilities, allowing them to select a loadout best suited for their play style.

As fans anticipate the open beta launch, 1047 Games has unveiled a roadmap, showing what is coming to the game on May 22 and in the following months. Specifically, the developer revealed that the Splitgate 2 open beta will launch with nine new maps and three new modes. In addition, The Lab will launch alongside the beta, providing players with a map creator for making custom content. Inspired by Halo ’s Forge mode, the creative mode could add longevity to the game by allowing fans to introduce their original designs for the community to check out. The beta will also include a battle pass, a new power weapon, and weekly playlists based on the community's preferences.

Spiltgate 2 Content Roadmap

May 22 - Open Beta

  • Nine new maps
  • Three new modes
  • "The Lab" map creator
  • Beta Battle Pass
  • New power weapon
  • Weekly playlists of community favorites

Summer 2025

  • Monthly map releases, reskins, changes, and more
  • Massive new modes
  • In-game events with earnable rewards
  • Weekly playlist updates
  • New power weapon
  • Map creator competitions
  • One more massive surprise

And Beyond

  • More weapons
  • More maps
  • More modes
  • More events
  • More skins
  • More surprises

Beyond the open beta launch, numerous other things are coming to Splitgate 2 in the summer of 2025. According to the developer, monthly content updates that feature map releases, reskins, and more will happen. Highlights from the roadmap include “massive” new modes, in-game events with the opportunity to earn rewards, another new power weapon, and weekly playlist updates. Furthermore, players will be able to showcase their map-building prowess in competitions featuring The Lab. 1047 Games also teased “one more massive surprise” coming to the game in the summer.

It is nice to see Splitgate 2 planning significant updates throughout its first year. Besides the summer content, the developer noted that more was heading to the game further down the road, including events. As this roadmap shows, 1047 Games looks committed to improving Splitgate 2 and adding more features for its fanbase.

It is worth pointing out that the open beta for Splitgate 2 will run until the 1.0 launch of the game this summer. This means players will be able to continue to provide feedback to the developer over the coming weeks. In addition, the progress from the open beta will transfer to the full game at release.

Portal into the action as an elite Ace in Splitgate 2, the only free-to-play shooter where you can teleport across the map to outsmart your opponents. Team up, customize weapons, and master portaling skills as you compete for glory in epic showdowns.

Evolution Is Here - This is the future of Splitgate, bringing fast-paced portal gunplay with objective-based game modes, distinctive new maps, and a wild collection of weapons.

Win From Any Angle - Dominate the competition with the ultimate tool: a portal gun. Flank your foes and turn the tide of combat by portaling across the map, or defy gravity to launch yourself for jaw-dropping aerial kills.

Team Up and Earn Glory - Recruit your friends and compete for the respect of the entire galaxy. Take control of the Hotzone while your friends hold off enemies portaling in from all sides. Stand together and steamroll your opponents to win the match and claim victory.

Multi-Team Mayhem - Take the action to the next level with the first of our upcoming Multi-Team-Mayhem modes, where 24 players compete in all-out warfare across a massive new map. Chaotic fun is guaranteed.

item.title: Rumor: Long-Running PlayStation Franchise Could Be Coming to Unexpected Platform
item.description:
Summary

  • MLB The Show may be coming to mobile devices, as hinted by a recent job listing from PlayStation.
  • PlayStation is looking for a senior project manager to help create "MLB The Show Mobile" at San Diego Studio.
  • The new mobile game is expected to have in-app purchases and live events.

The long-running MLB The Show franchise from PlayStation may be heading to mobile devices with a new game, according to a newly discovered job listing. The MLB The Show franchise has mostly stayed on consoles like PlayStation 5 and Nintendo Switch in recent years, with the sole exception being the companion app for MLB The Show 25 .

San Diego Studio's MLB The Show 25 was officially released on March 18 as the 20th installment in the mainline series. This release was notable, as it was the first time that the series was made exclusive to current-gen consoles, including Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. Since the game's launch, various updates for MLB The Show 25 have been released on a near-weekly basis. These updates typically include bug fixes and changes to in-game modes, including Road to the Show and Diamond Dynasty, based on player feedback. Although MLB The Show 25 has only been available for two months, it appears that PlayStation is already looking toward what's next for the franchise.

Reddit user AngieK22 recently discovered a new PlayStation job listing for a senior project manager for " MLB The Show Mobile ," which appears to be the first MLB The Show mobile game in the series. According to the job listing, the hire will work on-site at San Diego Studio, the development studio for MLB The Show , to work on MLB The Show Mobile with the studio's design, production, marketing, and data & analytics teams. The senior project manager's main goal will be "to drive new product features and optimize existing ones to make MLB The Show Mobile an amazing game."

MLB The Show Mobile Senior Project Manager Job Listing Has Surfaced Online

As the senior project manager, the hire will also seek opportunities to define in-game purchasing experiences and content, monetization strategies, and other product-related features in MLB The Show Mobile . In addition, the hire will collaborate with creative and product leadership to ensure returning MLB The Show players have access to a variety of features they want. The job listing didn't reveal any specific details about gameplay features for the new mobile game, but it's clear that the game will have in-app purchases and live events, similarly to other popular mobile games.

Some MLB The Show fans are cautiously optimistic about the potential mobile game from PlayStation and San Diego Studio, while others believe MLB The Show Mobile could be one of the most successful games in the franchise if done right. There are also plenty of fans wanting a port of MLB The Show 25 to other platforms, such as PC or Nintendo Switch 2, instead of a mobile version.

item.title: Marvel Rivals' Chrono Shield Card Controversy Explained
item.description:
NetEase Games' popular hero-shooter Marvel Rivals has been making headlines for its latest features, but not all this attention has been positive. To celebrate the first anniversary of Marvel Rivals ' Closed Alpha, the game introduced an event called Galacta's Gift. During the event, players can earn rewards like Nameplates, Sprays, and a Costume Coin, along with the return of the Season 0 Battle Pass.

Despite the festivities being underway, one feature in particular has been criticized: the addition of Chrono Shield Cards in Marvel Rivals ' latest update. A free reward obtainable in the Galacta's Gift pass, the item made its debut on May 15. However, even before its release, concerns were growing within the community about Chrono Shield Cards' potential impact on the game's competitive integrity.

Marvel Rivals' Ranked System Is Walking a Fine Line

How Chrono Shield Cards and Chrono Shields Work in Marvel Rivals

Marvel Rivals ' Chrono Shields have been integral to the ranked ladder since the game debuted in December 2024. Typically, in most competitive games, consecutive losses lead to rank demotion. Chrono Shields help prevent this by blocking one loss, but they go on cooldown afterward, allowing the next loss to affect rank. For Overwatch 2 players, a similar concept can be seen in the form of Demotion Protection, which triggers when a player's rank progress falls below 0%.

Notably, while Marvel Rivals ' playerbase was ultimately satisfied with how Chrono Shields functioned, the implementation of Chrono Shield Cards in Season 2 offset this balance. The item can be used at will to prevent a player from losing ranked points following defeat in a competitive match. Players are limited to 20 cards per season, and any unused cards expire at season’s end. From the Galacta's Gift event, players can obtain up to 8 Chrono Shield Cards from the available missions.

The Ongoing Debate Around Chrono Shield Cards

Initially, some players were aghast by the possibility that Chrono Shield Cards could be purchasable, raising concerns about a potential pay-to-win, or pay-to-not-lose, system. Fortunately, the developers addressed these concerns on social media platforms such as X (formerly Twitter), stating: "Both Chrono Shield Tokens from ranked matches and Chrono Shield Cards from events will not be for sale and are only usable for Gold rank and below." The reasoning cited is "to allow lower-ranked players to enter ranked mode with even less pressure through this mechanism."

Still, even though Chrono Shield Cards will not be purchasable and are ineffective for anyone Platinum rank or higher, some are worried about the game's competitive fairness. In the gaming community, some believe it's already too easy to climb in Marvel Rivals and that if one puts enough time into the game, they can climb into higher elos without maintaining a positive win-loss rate. Therefore, some players who want a more competitive environment believe that Chrono Shield Cards are unnecessary. A few of the reasons include not only that the cards offer a get-out-of-jail-free option that defeats the purpose of grinding and the grief that comes from a loss, but also that they may encourage trolls and throwers, who justify not trying by claiming they’ll use a Chrono Shield Card to mitigate the loss.

The cards offer a get-out-of-jail-free option that defeats the purpose of grinding and the grief that comes from a loss.

Alternatively, some players have expressed appreciation for the new item, citing that after a long day of work, it's nice to have a way to offset a ranked loss. Others in the community have echoed this sentiment, noting that the feature only benefits lower-ranked players and shouldn't concern others. As NetEase Games pointed out, this feature may help reduce pressure and make it easier for players to earn Marvel Rivals ' Gold-ranked rewards.
